author: Jeffm436
post_text: October 23, 2015 at 11:02 PM#1Looking for help to write a macro that turns on and off a NPU as a session member.  Any advice would be a great help.Thanks

posts.author: Jeffm436
posts.post_text: October 23, 2015 at 11:02 PM#1Looking for help to write a macro that turns on and off a NPU as a session member.  Any advice would be a great help.Thanks

posts.author: glad
posts.post_text: October 23, 2015 at 11:25 PM#2check out this post:http://ma-share.net/forum/read.php?8,45634,45635#msg-45635allthough the example given is for MSC, the described procedure applies for NPU sessionmembership or any other settings you want to change with a macro

posts.author: Jeffm436
posts.post_text: October 24, 2015 at 1:25 AM#3Thanks worked through it.To make NPU an active session member code is: Assign Root 5.3.NPU /sessionmember=yesTo make NPU not an active session member code is: Assign Root 5.3.NPU /sessionmember=noIn the code change NPU to the name of the NPU you want in or out of the session.

title: NPU Session member Macro
